Posts.EditableText: [quote="francisstokes":29ez1usm]my band played some songs today for assembley.There were about 300 kids there...whats your biggest crowd?[/quote:29ez1usm] I've played drums in an orchestra infront of over 1000 people at one of the UK's most famous venues (Winter Gardens and Grand Theatre in Blackpool). My band is hard rock, 70's style. we just spent around 2,800 pounds on new gear. 2000 on P.A, 800 on electric drum kit so it's pretty awesome. Got a demo going around Manchester (UK's most famous music city), so it's all good from here onwards

Posts.EditableText:
GIG TONIGHT

Playing in Poulton, home of the chav.  I just hope it's in the quiter area so i don't get stabbed after the gig.  we play at 11:20 - 12am.  Another Jam night so it should be fun since i haven't heard of the other bands before.  Makes a nice change.

I will post the results later tonight or tomorrow.

Posts.EditableText:
gig was AMAZING.  lots of GREAT bands, good audience, awesome sound.  We played last, so didn't have a BIG audience as it was from 8-10:30pm, but we got a good applause and the audience was really interested.

We got offered a payed gig for the 3rd of July, so that's pretty cool.

Probably our best gig yet, and many more to come.

Due to the band having the same name as 7 other bands, we will be changing our name to "Tequila Mockingbirds".

Goodnight
Posts.HTML:

Posts.EditableText:
wow, alot went on since i last posted.  Band split up, i went and joined a new band, did a festival in blackburn.  I had a talk with my old band and we got some new stuff together, and a new bassist.  Did that 3rd of July gig.  Not many people turned up actually, but we were support by one of the best bands in Blackpool (they won battle of the bands).

The sound wasn't too good, monitor was crap, electric drum kit was crap, but it was worth the 20 quid i got out of the little we got paid lol.

Anyway, after i re-joined, they'd changed the name to Wyldkard.  This one will stick hopefully.

I'm working on my 2 solo singles, but i'll probably get a backing band, since we will have our own recording studio in a week's time.

------------------------------------

Oh, and to those wondering.  I have a busy life, with a full-time job, my partner needs alot of attention lol, and my music is important to me.  I am in the process of making that game (alot has changed since then too), which should be ready for a stress test once i get these sprites done.
Posts.HTML:
wow, alot went on since i last posted. Band split up, i went and joined a new band, did a festival in blackburn. I had a talk with my old band and we got some new stuff together, and a new bassist. Did that 3rd of July gig. Not many people turned up actually, but we were support by one of the best bands in Blackpool (they won battle of the bands).

The sound wasn't too good, monitor was crap, electric drum kit was crap, but it was worth the 20 quid i got out of the little we got paid lol.

Anyway, after i re-joined, they'd changed the name to Wyldkard. This one will stick hopefully.

I'm working on my 2 solo singles, but i'll probably get a backing band, since we will have our own recording studio in a week's time.

------------------------------------

Oh, and to those wondering. I have a busy life, with a full-time job, my partner needs alot of attention lol, and my music is important to me. I am in the process of making that game (alot has changed since then too), which should be ready for a stress test once i get these sprites done.
